comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT of Feb 17, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9802E7DF163AE633A... reports, "A car was hurled from the elevated structure at Eighth Avenue and 138th Street at 7:30 o'clock last night. It swung in mid-air, suspended by the coupling, which attached it to the five other cars of the train. In his seat in the forward end was the motorman, John H. Becker of 338 Dill Place, Evergreen, Long Island, and a snow pile saved him." The train was empty apart from the driver.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for the link, swanq. What a ride that must have been! We'll add the additional information the next time we update the record.
